Description: Lower body and conical foot sherd of probably East Dorian pottery cup, presumably with everted rim; glazed fired brown, and worn; wholly glazed save underside; inscription on underside.
Curator's comments: The shape of the conical foot is similar to that of East Dorian cups with everted rim; see British Museum 1886,0401.96; 1886,0401.706. The number in Petrie's catalogue, 354, is written in ink on the underside of the foot.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIII, no. 354)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 672, no. 315)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p.257, no.3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GM.9) (phase 3)
